newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq stocks rebound, close higher.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq stocks rebound, close higher.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks bounced back on Wednesday as money continued to pour into the stock market and shares of Intel Corp, Baby Superstore Inc and Microsoft Corp pushed higher.
The Nasdaq Composite Index gained 14.6 points, or 1.2 percent, to unofficially end at the session-high 1236, while advances led declining issues by 2390 to 1739 on volume of about 580 million shares.
Intel rallied 3-1/4 to 99 on strong outlooks provided by key personal computer and networking companies.
The rally in shares of Baby Superstore followed the announcement that Toys R Us was acquiring the company in a stock merger valued at $376 million. Baby Superstore shares were up five at 24-7/8.
Another high tech putting in a strong performance was Microsoft Corp whose shares were up 2-5/8 at 134-3/4.

But the day's most active stock, DSC Communications Corp, was down 4-3/4 at 16-3/4. The company said on Wednesday that earnings for the third quarter are expected to be about breakeven, before a special charge of about $96 million, or $60 million after taxes.
